info.game_comments:
2001 Celebrity Jeopardy! game 4.
From the Las Vegas Hilton.

(1, 1).clue: The King had 18 No. 1 hits, including this one that he's performing in the following

(2, 1).clue: Major varieties of these circus performers include harlequin, tramp & whiteface

(3, 1).clue: This Colorado capital was the first city to use the Community Chest to finance its charitable agencies

(4, 1).clue: On TV, when a bad guy's car goes off the road & down a cliff, this tank usually explodes

(5, 1).clue: A giant moose & some Mounties will greet us at the casino named for this country, my birthplace

(6, 1).clue: It's the 6-letter "V" word for what Lance's bird, seen here, is about to do

(1, 2).clue: A sandwich that was fit for the King included peanut butter & this fruit, mashed

(2, 2).clue: Type of circus sideshow denizen seen here

(3, 2).clue: This state capital is located about 2,500 miles west of Los Angeles

(4, 2).clue: As its name suggests, the explosion of this substance propels bullets

(5, 2).clue: We'll eat Gouda cheese as we tiptoe through the tulip-shaped casino named for this country

(1, 3).clue: This song heard here stayed on the Top 100 chart for 27 weeks

(2, 3).clue: Last name of the circus man P.T. Barnum teamed up with in 1881

(3, 3).clue: You'll find the John F. Kennedy Federal Building in this state capital

(4, 3).clue: This "candle", a type of firework, splits up its charge to produce separate groups of sparks

(5, 3).clue: This U.K. country's casino will have kilt-wearing croupiers & an all-you-can-eat haggis buffet

(1, 4).clue: It's the title of a 1964 movie & the 1964 hit heard here

(2, 4).clue: Midge & Madge, who star in the Acme Miniature Circus, are 2 of these performing insects

(3, 4).clue: This state capital's metropolitan area includes the cities of Glendale, Scottsdale & Sun City

(4, 4).clue: A WWII type of this small hand-thrown weapon was called a "pineapple"

(1, 5).clue: Once he became Elvis' manager (for up to a 50% fee), he never took on another client

(2, 5).clue: This 1952 Cecil B. DeMille production was the "Greatest" of circus movies

(3, 5).clue: This capital is the headquarters for UPS, the Turner Broadcasting System & Delta Air Lines

(4, 5).clue: In a supernova, one of these collapses & explodes, releasing lots of energy

(1, 1).clue: King Ferdinand & Queen Isabella of Spain sent this explorer on his 1492 voyage

(2, 1).clue: Vegans prefer to let these hatch; they cook with flax seed or lecithin instead

(3, 1).clue: Chapter 83 of this Herman Melville novel is entitled "Jonah Historically Regarded"

(4, 1).clue: Grey Goose is a French brand of this colorless liquor more associated with Russia

(5, 1).clue: Of 3,000, 3,000,000 or 30,000,000, the one closest to the Sahara Desert's total square miles

(6, 1).clue: To degenerate quickly is to go "to Hell in" one of these

(1, 2).clue: The funeral mask of this "Boy King" is seen here

(2, 2).clue: Donald Watson coined the word vegan when he got tired of writing out "total" this

(4, 2).clue: Apricot brandy & gin go into a cocktail named for this tall pink bird

(5, 2).clue: The word Sahara means "desert" in this language of north Africa & the Middle East

(6, 2).clue: "He who pays" this musician "calls the tune"

(1, 3).clue: A translation of the Bible is named for this king of England & Scotland

(2, 3).clue: It's not surprising that the first U.S. vegan society was started in this state

(4, 3).clue: One variety of Haagen-Dazs ice cream soaks raisins in this potent potable

(6, 3).clue: One who endures a severe & prolonged hardship has "the patience of" this Old Testament guy

(1, 4).clue: This king divorced the Church of England from the Catholic Church so that he could divorce the first of 6 wives

(2, 4).clue: Once TV's "Bionic Woman", she co-wrote a cookbook for vegans called "The High Road to Health"

(4, 4).clue: Traditionally served at the Kentucky Derby, it's bourbon over crushed ice, garnished with mint

(1, 5).clue: France's King Louis XVI was married to this woman who supposedly said, "Let them eat cake"

(2, 5).clue: Vegans shun dairy foods, so the American Dietetic Assoc. wants to make sure they get enough of this element

(4, 5).clue: A margarita made with brandy & sugar instead of tequila & salt, or a motorcycle attachment

(6, 5).clue: To eat crow is "to eat" this type of "pie"

(0, 0).clue: A current U.S. governor, he hosted the game show "Grudge Match" in 1991
